marklogic.body:
Not only that, when you look at overall academia research, not that much actually originates from Ivy league universities.
For once you are Spot on though. Personally, I find their degrees a bit of a farce and actually prefer kids educated abroad. They're generally ready to hit the ground running, have a great work ethos, and do not come with this entitled pompous ivy attitude.
Worse is those from the growing number of state colleges whose sole focus is now college football.
Another joke is those who complete a Bachelors and masters in one shot. Masters really, you're barely Off your parent's bosom yet are apparently a master at something you read in a text book.
